sentence.Network_en: We'll have to bide our time until the rain stops.

jx.jx_en_mean: wait quietly for a good opportunity to do something

lj.lj_ly: she patiently bided her time before making an escape bid.
lj.lj_ls: 她耐心地等待时机，然后才试图逃脱。

jx.jx_cn_mean: 等待时机，耐心等待：等待更进一步的发展

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English  bīdan, of Germanic origin

entry.def: If you bide your time, you wait for a good opportunity before doing something.

example.ex: He was content to bide his time patiently, waiting for the opportunity to approach her.
example.tran: 他乐于耐心等待接近她的良机。

sentences.sentence: "You can stay with me while you are in town"
"stay a bit longer--the day is still young"

auth_sentence.content: I bide my time and I don't move on very quickly.
auth_sentence.res_content: I bide my time and I don't move on very quickly.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I bide my time and I don't move on very quickly.

auth_sentence.content: Hermit crabs bide their time, eyeing up the homes of winkles and whelks.
auth_sentence.res_content: Hermit crabs bide their time, eyeing up the homes of winkles and whelks.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Hermit crabs bide their time, eyeing up the homes of winkles and whelks.

auth_sentence.content: Others seemed keen to avoid passing judgement, focusing instead on the family's loss, or preferring perhaps to bide their time.
auth_sentence.res_content: Others seemed keen to avoid passing judgement, focusing instead on the family's loss, or preferring perhaps to bide their time.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Others seemed keen to avoid passing judgement, focusing instead on the family's loss, or preferring perhaps to bide their time.

sentences.en: We’ll have to bide our time until the rain stops.
She’s just biding her time until the right job comes along.
sentences.cn: 她还在等待看有没有合适的工作。

sentences.en: Jack was hurt deeply, and he bided his time for revenge.
sentences.cn: 杰克受了很深的伤害,他等待着报仇的时机。
